title: How to Clean and Polish Silver with Cream of Tartar

steps.headline: Clean it with cream of tartar, a.k.a.

steps.headline: Dissolve one teaspoon of cream of tartar in one cup of water in a small mixing bowl.

text: Clean it with cream of tartar, a.k.a. potassium hydrogen tartrate. This is a natural acid that comes from grapes and other fruits. It is usually used in cooking, but its acidic properties make it great for cleaning silver. You can find it in most grocery stores in the spice section. Dissolve one teaspoon of cream of tartar in one cup of water in a small mixing bowl. Immerse one cup in the solution for five minutes. This step serves as an initial cleaning and also helps to loosen up the tarnish for the next step. Remove the cup from the solution. Then wipe it dry with a soft towel. Scrub the silver with a toothbrush using a paste made from cream of tartar and a few drops of water. You can just pour about a teaspoon of cream of tartar into a small bowl, wet your toothbrush, and then dip it into the powder. Scrub a bit, and then re-wet and re-dip the brush as necessary. Scrub it all over until it is clean and polished. The difference is striking!
